00058 /*****************************************************************************\
00059  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00060  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00061  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00062  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00063  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00064  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00065  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00066 \*****************************************************************************/
00067 
00068 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00069 #include <config.h>
00070 #ifdef M_X86_FOR_HCODE
00071 #include <Hcode/h_ccode.h>
00072 #endif
00073 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00074 #include "m_spec.h"
00075 #include "m_x86.h"
00076 
00077 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00078 #define M_X86_SIZE_VOID         0
00079 #define M_X86_SIZE_BIT          1
00080 #define M_X86_SIZE_CHAR         8
00081 #define M_X86_SIZE_SHORT        16
00082 #define M_X86_SIZE_INT          32
00083 #define M_X86_SIZE_LONG         32
00084 #define M_X86_SIZE_FLOAT        32
00085 #define M_X86_SIZE_DOUBLE       64
00086 #define M_X86_SIZE_POINTER      32
00087 #define M_X86_SIZE_UNION        -1
00088 #define M_X86_SIZE_STRUCT       -1
00089 #define M_X86_SIZE_BLOCK        -1
00090 #define M_X86_SIZE_MAX          64
00091 
00092 #define M_X86_ALIGN_VOID        -1
00093 #define M_X86_ALIGN_BIT         1
00094 #define M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR        8
00095 #define M_X86_ALIGN_SHORT       16
00096 #define M_X86_ALIGN_INT         32
00097 #define M_X86_ALIGN_LONG        32
00098 #define M_X86_ALIGN_FLOAT       32
00099 #define M_X86_ALIGN_DOUBLE      32
00100 #define M_X86_ALIGN_POINTER     32
00101 #define M_X86_ALIGN_UNION       -1      /* depends on the field */
00102 #define M_X86_ALIGN_STRUCT      -1
00103 #define M_X86_ALIGN_BLOCK       -1
00104 #define M_X86_ALIGN_MAX         64
00105 
00106 int
00107 M_x86_type_size (int mtype)
00108 {
00109   switch (mtype)
00110     {
00111     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00112       return M_X86_SIZE_VOID;
00113     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00114       return M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00115     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00116       return M_X86_SIZE_BIT;
00117     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00118       return M_X86_SIZE_CHAR;
00119     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00120       return M_X86_SIZE_SHORT;
00121     case M_TYPE_INT:
00122       return M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00123     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00124       return M_X86_SIZE_LONG;
00125     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00126       return M_X86_SIZE_FLOAT;
00127     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00128       return M_X86_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00129     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00130       return M_X86_SIZE_POINTER;
00131     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00132       return M_X86_SIZE_UNION;
00133     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00134       return M_X86_SIZE_STRUCT;
00135     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00136       return M_X86_SIZE_BLOCK;
00137     default:
00138       return -1;
00139     }
00140 }
00141 
00142 int
00143 M_x86_type_align (int mtype)
00144 {
00145   switch (mtype)
00146     {
00147     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00148       return M_X86_ALIGN_VOID;
00149     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00150       return M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00151     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00152       return M_X86_ALIGN_BIT;
00153     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00154       return M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00155     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00156       return M_X86_ALIGN_SHORT;
00157     case M_TYPE_INT:
00158       return M_X86_ALIGN_INT;
00159     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00160       return M_X86_ALIGN_LONG;
00161     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00162       return M_X86_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00163     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00164       return M_X86_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00165     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00166       return M_X86_ALIGN_POINTER;
00167     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00168       return M_X86_ALIGN_UNION;
00169     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00170       return M_X86_ALIGN_STRUCT;
00171     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00172       return M_X86_ALIGN_BLOCK;
00173     default:
00174       return -1;
00175     }
00176 }
00177 
00178 void
00179 M_x86_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00180 {
00181   type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00182   type->unsign = unsign;
00183   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_CHAR;
00184   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_CHAR;
00185   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_CHAR;
00186 }
00187 
00188 void
00189 M_x86_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00190 {
00191   type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00192   type->unsign = unsign;
00193   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_SHORT;
00194   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_SHORT;
00195   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_SHORT;
00196 }
00197 
00198 void
00199 M_x86_int (M_Type type, int unsign)
00200 {
00201   type->type = M_TYPE_INT;
00202   type->unsign = unsign;
00203   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_INT;
00204   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00205   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_INT;
00206 }
00207 
00208 void
00209 M_x86_long (M_Type type, int unsign)
00210 {
00211   type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00212   type->unsign = unsign;
00213   type->align = M_X86_ALIGN_LONG;
00214   type->size = M_X86_SIZE_LONG;
00215   type->nbits = M_X86_SIZE_LONG;
00216 }
00217 
00218 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00219 int
00220 M_x86_layout_order (void)
00221 {
00222   return M_LITTLE_ENDIAN;
00223 }
00224 
00225 
00226 void
00227 M_set_model_x86 (char *model_name)
00228 {
00229   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "386"))
00230     M_model = M_386;
00231   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "486"))
00232     M_model = M_486;
00233   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Pentium"))
00234     M_model = M_PENTIUM;
00235   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "Krypton") ||
00236            !strcasecmp (model_name, "K5"))
00237     M_model = M_KRYPTON;
00238   else
00239     M_assert (0, "M_set_model_x86:  Illegal model specified!");
00240 }
